content.full_text: Fitz Henry Warren to Abraham Lincoln, 9 April 18491 I have the honor to inform you, that thePostmaster Generalhas appointedHenry SteesPostmaster atMount Carmelin the State ofIllinoisin place ofWmArbuthnot– Removed2
paragraphs: Fitz Henry Warren to Abraham Lincoln, 9 April 18491
I have the honor to inform you, that thePostmaster Generalhas appointedHenry SteesPostmaster atMount Carmelin the State ofIllinoisin place ofWmArbuthnot– Removed2
citations:
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, 145 rolls,  Records of the Post Office Department,
                     RG 28, 1845-1855, 18:192, National Archives Building, Washington, DC;Register of all Officers and Agents, Civil, Military, and Naval, in the Service of
                        the United States, on   the Thirtieth September, 1849(Washington, DC: Gideon, 1849), *482;Register of all Officers and Agents, Civil, Military, and Naval, in the Service of
                        the United States, on   the Thirtieth September, 1851(Washington, DC: Gideon, 1851), 541*;Register of Officers and Agents, Civil, Military, and Naval, in the Service of the
                        United States, on   the Thirtieth September, 1853(Washington, DC: Robert Armstrong, 1853), *511;Register of Officers and Agents, Civil, Military, and Naval, in the Service of the
                        United States, on   the Thirtieth September, 1855(Washington, DC: A. O. P. Nicholson, 1855), *339.

footnotes.text: 1Fitz Henry Warren signed his name to this form letter.

2Henry Stees held the position until December 1853.Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, 145 rolls,  Records of the Post Office Department,

                        United States, on   the Thirtieth September, 1853(Washington, DC: Robert Armstrong, 1853), *511;Register of Officers and Agents, Civil, Military, and Naval, in the Service of the
                        United States, on   the Thirtieth September, 1855(Washington, DC: A. O. P. Nicholson, 1855), *339.
